questions.question: When checking belts during a pre-trip inspection, how much play should they have at the center?
questions.explanation: Check belts for snugness - they should have 1/2 to 3/4 inch play at the center of the belt.

questions.question: The air compressor governor cut-out should occur at approximately what pressure?
questions.explanation: The air compressor builds air pressure to governor cut-out at approximately 120-140 psi or as specified by manufacturer.

questions.question: During the air brake check, what is the maximum air pressure drop allowed in one minute for a single vehicle with the foot brake fully applied?
questions.explanation: For a single vehicle, air pressure should not drop more than 3 psi in one minute with the foot brake fully applied.

questions.question: During the air brake check, what is the maximum air pressure drop allowed in one minute for a combination vehicle?
questions.explanation: For a combination vehicle, air pressure should not drop more than 4 psi in one minute with the foot brake fully applied.

questions.question: The low air pressure warning devices must activate before air pressure drops below:
questions.explanation: Low air warning devices (buzzer, light, flag) should activate before air pressure drops below 55 psi.

questions.question: On a tractor-trailer, the tractor protection valve and parking brake valve should close (pop out) at what air pressure range?
questions.explanation: At a range between 20-45 psi on a tractor-trailer combination, the tractor protection valve and parking brake valve should close (pop out).

questions.question: What is the minimum tread depth required on steering axle tires?
questions.explanation: Steering axle tires require a minimum tread depth of 4/32 inch.

questions.question: What is the minimum tread depth required on all non-steering tires?
questions.explanation: All non-steering tires require a minimum tread depth of 2/32 inch.

questions.question: For manual slack adjusters, how far should the brake pushrod move when pulled by hand (with brakes released)?
questions.explanation: For manual slack adjusters, the brake pushrod should not move more than one inch when pulled by hand with brakes released.

questions.question: When performing the hydraulic brake check, how many times should you pump the brake pedal before holding it down?
questions.explanation: Pump the brake pedal three times, then hold it down for five seconds. The pedal should not move during those five seconds.

questions.question: When holding the hydraulic brake pedal down for the brake check, how long should you hold it?
questions.explanation: After pumping three times, hold the brake pedal down for five seconds. It should not move (depress) during this time.

questions.question: What speed should you travel when performing the service brake check?
questions.explanation: Pull forward at 5 mph, apply the service brake and stop to check that the vehicle stops properly and doesn't pull to either side.

questions.question: What emergency equipment is required on all commercial vehicles?
choices: Three red triangles and a first aid kit
Fire extinguisher and a first aid kit
Triangles, fusees or flares, and fire extinguisher
First aid kit, fire extinguisher, and flares
questions.explanation: Required emergency equipment includes three red reflective triangles, 6 fusees or 3 liquid burning flares, and a properly charged fire extinguisher.

questions.question: When should you check the engine oil level?
choices: Only when the engine is warm
questions.explanation: Check oil level when the engine is off. The oil level must be above the refill mark.

questions.question: What is the proper procedure for a safe start?
choices: Start the engine with the vehicle in gear
Put gearshift in neutral or park, then start
Press the accelerator while turning the key
Release the parking brake before starting
questions.explanation: For a safe start, place gearshift in neutral (or park for automatics), depress clutch before starting, and release clutch slowly after engine reaches idle.

questions.question: How do you check the parking brake during a pre-trip inspection?
choices: Engage it and check the dashboard light
Engage it and gently try to pull forward
Press the brake pedal while in park
Engage it and listen for air release
questions.explanation: With air pressure built to governor cutout and parking brake engaged, check that it holds by gently trying to pull forward.

questions.question: What color should clearance lights be on the rear of the vehicle?
questions.explanation: Clearance lights should be red on the rear and amber elsewhere on the vehicle.

questions.question: What color should reflectors be on the rear of the vehicle?
questions.explanation: Reflectors should be red on the rear and amber elsewhere on the vehicle.

questions.question: When inspecting the steering linkage, what should you check?
choices: Steering wheel free play and tilt
Links, arms, and joints for wear or looseness
Power steering fluid level and color
questions.explanation: Check that connecting links, arms, and rods are not worn or cracked. Joints and sockets should not be worn or loose, with no missing nuts, bolts, or cotter keys.

questions.question: What should you look for when inspecting leaf springs?
choices: Missing, shifted, cracked, or broken springs
Only springs that are visibly broken
Rust and corrosion on spring mounts
Number of leaves compared to other axles
questions.explanation: Look for missing, shifted, cracked, or broken leaf springs during the suspension inspection.

questions.question: What are lug nuts signs of looseness?
questions.explanation: Signs of loose lug nuts include rust trails or shiny threads. All lug nuts must be present and free of cracks and distortions.

questions.question: What should you check on the fifth wheel skid plate?
choices: That it is clean and free of dirt
questions.explanation: Check that the fifth wheel skid plate has proper lubrication and is securely mounted with all bolts and pins secure.

questions.question: When checking the coupling, what should you verify about the locking jaws?
choices: They are closed around the kingpin
They are slightly open for flex
questions.explanation: Look into the fifth wheel gap and check that locking jaws are fully closed around the kingpin.

questions.question: What should be checked regarding the trailer and fifth wheel connection?
choices: There should be a small gap for flexibility
The trailer should sit flat with no gap
A slight gap is normal and acceptable
The gap varies by trailer manufacturer
questions.explanation: Check that the trailer is lying flat on the fifth wheel skid plate with no gap.

questions.question: On school buses, what additional emergency equipment must be inspected?
choices: A spare tire and jack kit
Emergency kit and body fluid cleanup kit
An extra set of mirrors and fuses
questions.explanation: School bus drivers must also inspect the emergency kit and body fluid cleanup kit in addition to standard emergency equipment.

questions.question: What must school bus drivers check regarding the stop arm?
choices: That it retracts automatically when driving
That it is secure and extends fully when used
That it is the correct shade of red
That it makes an audible clicking sound
questions.explanation: Check that the stop arm is mounted securely to the frame, check for loose fittings and damage, and verify it extends fully when operated.

questions.question: What should you verify about school bus emergency exits?
choices: They are locked during transit at all times
They operate smoothly and warnings work
They can only be opened from the outside
They are sealed shut with no visible gaps
questions.explanation: Demonstrate that emergency exits are not damaged, operate smoothly, close securely, and that emergency exit warning devices are working properly.

questions.question: When checking brake drums, what should you look for?
choices: Only visible cracks on the outer surface
Only that the drums are not discolored
That the drums spin freely by hand
questions.explanation: Check brake drums for cracks, dents, or holes, loose or missing bolts, and contaminants such as debris or oil/grease.

questions.question: What is the correct way to check tire inflation during a pre-trip?
questions.explanation: Check for proper inflation by using a tire gauge. You will not get credit for simply kicking the tires or using a mallet.

questions.question: What happens if you fail to perform all three components of the air brake check?
choices: You lose 5 points from your total score
You receive a warning but can continue
Automatic failure of the inspection test
You must retake only the air brake portion
questions.explanation: Failure to perform all three components of the air brake check correctly will result in an automatic failure of the vehicle inspection test.
